page.title: 02Trewithen Home Farm
page.content: The Trewithen Estate employs a farm manager to look after its farms in this area.It is a difficult job because the people that they grow the crops for often change their minds about what they want.It is quite an expensive job also,for it costs about Â£500,000 per year to keep the farms running.There are 400 cows(fresian) and 250 young cows. Cereal production is also quite high for there are 500 acres of barley,160 acres of oil seed rape,453 acres of wheat and 111 acres of peas.All together there are 1900 acres owned by the Trewithen Home where the farm manager works.One of the farms owned by Trewithen Estate is Golden farm on an ancient site.It has 50 cows and they produce 2500 litres of milk per day at the Dairy .
